solution_line_template: The first person had {first_person_fraction} of all his teeth removed, a total of {first_person_fraction}*{initial_teeth_per_person} = <<{first_person_fraction}*{initial_teeth_per_person}={first_person_removed_teeth}>>{first_person_removed_teeth} teeth.

The second person had {second_person_fraction} of his teeth removed, meaning {second_person_fraction}*{initial_teeth_per_person} = <<{second_person_fraction}*{initial_teeth_per_person}={second_person_removed_teeth}>>{second_person_removed_teeth} of his teeth were removed.

Together, the first and the second person had {second_person_removed_teeth}+{first_person_removed_teeth} = <<{second_person_removed_teeth}+{first_person_removed_teeth}={first_and_second_total_removed}>>{first_and_second_total_removed} teeth removed in total.

The third person had half of his teeth removed, which were {initial_teeth_per_person}/{third_person_denominator} = <<{initial_teeth_per_person}/{third_person_denominator}={third_person_removed_teeth}>>{third_person_removed_teeth} teeth.

The first three people had a total of {first_and_second_total_removed}+{third_person_removed_teeth} = <<{first_and_second_total_removed}+{third_person_removed_teeth}={first_three_total_removed}>>{first_three_total_removed} teeth removed from their mouth.

The last person only had {last_person_removed_teeth} teeth removed, bringing the total number of teeth removed at the dentist clinic to be {first_three_total_removed}+{last_person_removed_teeth} = <<{first_three_total_removed}+{last_person_removed_teeth}={total_teeth_removed}>>{total_teeth_removed} teeth.
